Don't remember that much patriotic celebrations after Christian abortionist killer got arrested. For you sick boy, they are all the same. Oh! Those guns. Get off this horse, doofus. This horsie is dead. can't you see? Your Democrat controlled Senate stopped gun control bill. Another blow for Obama. You forgot to mention that 2/3 of those non-accidental gun deaths are suicides. Number of deaths from car accidents is 3x-4x higher than from guns. Where is Obama and his crowd doing something against those killer-cars?

Topic.Title: Was Mccain a terrorist? He was sent to bomb civilians

Message.Msg: the power plant was purely civilian. In fact most bombing of N. viet..was nothing but terror bombing of the civilian populace. The N viets had about zero manufacturing and certainly the weapons they used were not manufactured there....( nor had they ever attacked the USA, certainly were not a threat to the USA , and in fact were the very same people who were our allies in ousting the Japanese and their Vichy French puppet rulers , and the very same people McCain hugged a few years ago and who have been a favored USA trading partner, Nam was a war based on lies, the whole thing was a war crime) He [ McNamara] [1968 ] bluntly admitted that there was "no basis to believe that any bombing campaign...would by itself force Ho Chi Minh's regime into submission, short, that is, of the virtual annihilation of North Vietnam and its people."[98] Robert McNamara On 31 December 1967, the Department of Defense announced that 864,000 tons of American bombs had been dropped on North Vietnam during Rolling Thunder, compared with 653,000 tons dropped during the entire Korean War and 503,000 tons in the Pacific theater during the Second World War.[108] .....PBS estimate that the 3.5 year Operation Rolling Thunder killed 182,000 civilians........................

Message.Title: Obama not worth a damn
Message.Msg: Many have left the military and the State Department.
Under Bush, most left the Military in boxes.

Unfit to be Commander in Chief On July 7, 2011, U.S. troop deaths from the war in Afghanistan since President Obama took office reached 1,000. That means that nearly two-thirds of the U.S. fatalities in the war in Afghanistan have occurred during the Obama administration, which has managed the war for a mere quarter of its duration. These numbers should give us pause. While the Administration has publicly conceded that there is no military solution in Afghanistan, and claimed that it supports 'Afghan-led reconciliation', its policy on the ground is marked by a refusal to establish a timetable for full military withdrawal. The Administration has even backed away from the 'substantial drawdown' of troops that was promised to begin this July, instead opting for a token drawdown that will leave about twice as many troops in the country as were there when he assumed office, with no plan for their removal. See Just Foreign Policy's press release marking this grim milestone here. We must ask ourselves how many more lives will be sacrificed before the Obama administration sets a clear end date for America's longest war.

KABUL, Afghanistan — The killing of an American serviceman in an exchange of fire with allied Afghan soldiers pushed U.S. military deaths in the war to 2,000, a cold reminder of Obama's treachery. Huffington Post September 2012
hey dukky if yuo don"t like what the u s a gov.go to live in another country maybe a musslim one.

Topic.Title: Was Mccain a terrorist? He was sent to bomb civilians

Message.Msg: What this whole issue comes down to is this: I believe President Obama is doing the right thing by not putting 'boots on the ground' anywhere. Once the President committs troops to places like Libya, Syria, and other places the troops will be there for some time. Some American entanglements started out as 'police actions' but developed into fullfledged wars. Americans need to forget about 'nation building' and bringing democracy to those who don't want it. If it were up to politicians like John McCain and his buddy Joe Lieberman, this country would be again involved in wars with troops on the ground, somewhere in the Middle East. I'd say, let Muslims destroy themselves, they don't want our help. To hell with the 'Arab Spring' - let them fight it and not us. It is truly sad that the United Nation lacks the power of enforcement.

Topic.Title: Was Mccain a terrorist? He was sent to bomb civilians

Message.Msg: There is no such thing as a "purely civilian" power plant. Power plants operate industry which fuels the war effort, power plants are totally legitimate targets.

Topic.Title: Was Mccain a terrorist? He was sent to bomb civilians

Message.Msg: Further keep in mind you're attempting to apply 21st century technical standards on a war fought 50 years ago when we didn't have self guided munitions or a GPS system, and thus it was necessary to drop planeloads of bombs to destroy a target. Now if you want to talk war crime look to the fire bombing of Japanese cities prior to the A-Bomb attacks. We used a high altitude daytime strategic bomber to fly at low altitudes at night setting entire cities on fire. In fact just about the only intact cities left were the ones we picked as "example targets" for later A-Bomb attacks. Of course if the invasion of Japan had been deemed to be necessary the serviceman landing ashore would be glad for every one of those destroyed cities, as without face saving cause they would have NEVER surrendered.
